intro: Matthiola longipetala var. oxyceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
